definition: lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
chaste tree or berry (Vitex agnus-castus)/alternative name for the Zhou Dynasty state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
thorns

sentences.english: He went to strike at the hedge, but where his sword met the thorns, great roses bloomed instead.
sentences.chinese: 他開始披荊斬棘，但是他寶劍所到之處都開出了薔薇。

sentences.english: Enterprise clarifies, cuts through, and captures, the essence of the evolutionary spirit.
sentences.chinese: 進取心可以釐清一切，披荊斬棘直搗演化的精髓。

sentences.english: You know a heart of gold won't take you all the way.
sentences.chinese: 你要知道一顆善良的心不會一直庇佑爲你披荊斬棘。

sentences.english: But you possess the inner courage to see you through.
sentences.chinese: 你擁有披荊斬棘的勇氣。

sentences.english: We can march through only because you are leading the way ahead.
sentences.chinese: 有你在前面的披荊斬棘，纔有後面衆驢友的闊步前進。

sentences.english: The explorers had to beat a path through the dense bushes.
sentences.chinese: 探險家們得披荊斬棘，在茂密的灌木叢林中闢路前進。

sentences.english: Reincarnation, I dedicated to the pursuit, clearing a path through.
sentences.chinese: 輪迴裏，我執着地追尋，一路披荊斬棘。

definition: fortitude
to struggle arduously
glorious achievement (idiom)
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to meet a challenge
unyielding/indomitable
changeable situation (idiom)
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
prosperous and developing/flourishing
to spare no effort
to work hard
